medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute right flank pain with radiation to the right lower quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports that over the past few weeks, he has experienced decreased appetite and mild nausea. On the afternoon of presentation, he developed acute onset right flank pain with radiation to his right lower quadrant. The pain has been associated with urinary frequency, but there is no dysuria, urinary urgency, or hematuria. The current pain is similar to prior episodes of nephrolithiasis, though those were on the left side.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of nephrolithiasis, GERD, CAD, depression, CVA, hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, candidal esophagitis (resolved), and previous right elbow debridement for medial epicondylitis.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died of myocardial infarction (MI) at age of ___, father died of MI at age of ___. Maternal grandparents both died before ___ of MI. Mother has a history of depression and schizoaffective disorder.
